api
Class GoogleDocs

java.lang.Object
  api.GoogleDocs

public class GoogleDocs
extends java.lang.Object

The class handles interaction with GoogleDocs API including login, view and upload.

Method Detail

startAuth

public void startAuth(org.restlet.data.Request request,
                      org.restlet.data.Response response)
Start the authentication process with the GoogleDocs API. This invokes the AuthSub's first method getRequestUrl to get the authentication page's URL. The client is redirected to this page.

Parameters:
request -
response -

getToken

public java.lang.String getToken(org.restlet.data.Request request,
                                 org.restlet.data.Response response)
From the request, get the authentication token if available. First it checks if the token is available in the COOKIE. If not, then it checks the query parameters ?token= in the request URL. This is the case after user has completed the login on GoogleDocs page and the GoogleDocs page redirects the user to our page again with the token parameter. If no token is found in cookie or parameter, then authentication process is started. If a token is found in the query parameter, then it is exchanged for a session token using AuthSubUtil's method. The session token is set as a cookie so that next client request will have that session token in the cookie. If an error happens in exchanging the token, then the authentication process is started again.

Parameters:
request -
response -
Returns:
The session token string.

getTokenFromHeader

public java.lang.String getTokenFromHeader(org.restlet.data.Request request,
                                           org.restlet.data.Response response,
                                           java.lang.String nameToken)
Extract the token from the header of the request. This is used when the client is supplying the x-token header with username and token to be used for that client.

Parameters:
request -
response -

viewDocs

public org.w3c.dom.Node viewDocs()
                          throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                 java.io.IOException,
                                 com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException
View all the documents available in user's GoogleDocs account. It returns a XML Device element which contacts FileList which in turn contains File elements. Each File element describes a file in GoogleDocs. The generated XML has a URL element which allows the XSLT to use that URL to download the file directly from the GoogleDocs. The title of the document is used as the File's Name. The File's path is set to empty string. The getUpdated() and isTrashed() methods of the DocumentListEntry give information about LastModified and Deleted elements. The file Size is set as -1 which is rendered as "unknown" and represents unknown file size.

Returns:
The Node of elements representing files in GoogleDocs account.
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException
java.io.IOException
com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException

uploadFile

public void uploadFile(java.io.File file)
                throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                       java.io.IOException,
                       com.google.gdata.util.ServiceException
Upload a given local file to user's GoogleDocs account. It sets the Title of the document as the file name.

Parameters:
file -
Throws:
